intro: Lychnis diurna var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The glandular hairs on its stems and leaves are a distinguishing botanical feature.
